content: The Act titled "Medicaid Infant Mortality Amendments of 1993" provides phased-in coverage for pregnant women and infants up to 185 percent of the poverty level. The Social Security Act is amended to provide coverage for pregnant women and infants up to 185 percent of the poverty level, with phased-in percentages starting from July 1, 1994. The Social Security Act amendment ensures coverage for pregnant women and infants up to 185 percent of the poverty level, with phased-in percentages starting from July 1, 1994. The amendment also allows flexibility in income methodology and deduction of child care in the computation of income for medical assistance. The amendment to the Social Security Act ensures coverage for pregnant women and infants up to 185 percent of the poverty level, with flexibility in income methodology and deduction of child care costs for medical assistance. The amendment to the Social Security Act allows states the option to apply resource standards for individuals eligible for medical assistance, with restrictions on more restrictive standards. The amendments to the Social Security Act, effective July 1, 1994, apply higher income standards and income methodology for medical assistance eligibility without the need for final regulations. The amendments to the Social Security Act, effective July 1, 1994, do not require final regulations to be promulgated by a certain date. States with Medicaid plans needing legislation to meet new requirements have leeway until after the state legislature's first regular session following the enactment date. The amendments to the Social Security Act, effective July 1, 1994, allow states with Medicaid plans to make necessary legislative changes after the state legislature's first regular session following the enactment date. Each year of a 2-year legislative session is considered a separate regular session. SEC. 3. OPTIONAL COVERAGE OF PRENATAL AND POSTPARTUM HOME VISITATION SERVICES. Section 1905(a) of the Social Security Act is amended to include coverage for prenatal and postpartum home visitation services for high-risk pregnant women and infants under 1 year of age. This amendment also includes conforming amendments to Section 1902 of the Act. The effective date for the amendments made in this section is July 1, 1994, regardless of final regulations being in place.
